page_analysis.text_content:
Other excavation considerations

Architectural compatibility & landscape screening
• If a guard rail is required, it must be designed to be archi-
tecturally compatible with the residence.
• Additionally, landscape screening may be required by the
Planning Dept.

Tree protection
• A tree's root system extends well beyond the drip line and the
roots are likely to be within the first 18" below grade.
• It is important to plan excavation in a manner that does not
harm tree roots.
• Prior to issuance of building permit, owner to provide evidence
that encroaching features or portions of features will not harm
trees of any species on subject or abutting lots.
• Consult the city's Tree Technical Manual for other aspects of
tree protection during construction.

Fig 37 Excavation, landscape screening, and guard rails

Fig 38 Excavation and tree roots

Basement
Excav
featur
When planning a basement, consider the
extent of excavation that will be required e.g.,
some excavation techniques require (for safety
reasons) that the excavation to be at a 1:1
slope which may impact tree roots severely.
41

visual_elements.description: A cross-sectional diagram illustrating excavation for a building's basement. The diagram shows the side view of a building with a basement level. The ground level is indicated by a solid line, and below it, the basement wall is shown. To the right of the basement, an excavated area is depicted with dashed lines indicating the extent of excavation and hatched lines representing disturbed soil. The text 'Basement' is vertically aligned along the basement wall, and 'Excav featur' is vertically aligned along the excavation line.

A cross-sectional diagram illustrating excavation near a tree's root system. The diagram shows a building with a basement on the left, similar to Fig 37. To the right, a large tree with an extensive root system is depicted. A diagonal line, representing an excavation slope, extends from the ground level near the building towards the tree's root system, indicating potential impact. The text 'Basement' is vertically aligned along the basement wall, and 'Excav featur' is vertically aligned along the excavation line.

sections: Fig 37 Excavation, landscape screening, and guard rails

additional_notes: Page number '41' is present at the bottom right corner.
The text 'Excav featur' in the diagrams appears to be a truncated label, likely 'Excavation feature'.
